text:
Hi, I'm using Vagrant installation, when  I use a "query" method on my chaincode, I have a response, but if after this request I use the API (/blocks/'block nb' ) I haven't information concerning this 'query' is it normal ? because if I use an invoke 'method' I have this information.
thanks
Pascal
<@U1Z6V101X> do you mean tha t queries are not in the ledger?
I don't know, but if I request the API /127.0.0.1:5000/blocks/'block nb' I have no information concerning the query transaction, is it norma, a bug or an installation problem ?
what is block nb?
block number
okay so blocks are the parts of the ledger
ledger is made of blocks, in other words
but your query is not present in the last block (ot in some other)
so it is not in the ledger. and yes, this is normal. queries are just queries, as far as I know they are not persisted
yes not present in the last block, and if I verify all blocks, I have only 'deploy' and 'invoke' methods
that's the way it works :slightly_smiling_face:
so, we haven't information in the ledger concerning 'query methods' ?
ok , thanks for this info :slightly_smiling_face: but how can we check if a query worked well?
don't you get the result?
<@U1MJ9SRF0|alexho> has left the channel
ah ok yes you are  right, I have juste to use the result :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U24DVMR1U|cm> has joined the channel
<@U21NTHK7C> you can deploy docker containers to your vm, you don’t need to deploy vagrant. Use some of the Docker-Compose examples in the /examples folder as a guide
Thanks <@U0KM61BCP>, I already got ideas after reading some documents.
<@U24J6JYVC|benbooth> has joined the channel

hi ... just noticed that the usage FAQ (<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/FAQ/usage_FAQ.md>) retains the notion from the protocol spec that NV nodes maintain a full copy of the ledger for local queries. This would of course require both the chain and world state.

My question is whether this has been implemented recently, or is a misstatement as it was the last time I had this discussion on one of the hyperledger channels? Thanks.

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: THIS IS A READ-ONLY historic repository. Current development is at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/admin/projects/fabric> . pull requests not accepted

text: <@U0ULK2JPP> <@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0PB67X4K> Can you take a peek at my question? ^^^
<@U0Y55KNG2> I don’t know how much of NV got done (ie, will it sync up with the chain…. I didn’t think so but I could be wrong)…. <@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0PB67X4K> <@U0XPR4NP4> ?
What is the length of a fabric receiving address? Is it the same as sawtooth lake? (34 characters)

text: I am getting a hash sum mismatch error when I try to make a peer
i mean build a peer...
i think there might be an upstream problem in ubuntu

I see this from time to time, you just have to wait for them to fix it
<@U11HH3P7Y> that merely defines the relationship
it should only actually run the build if its needed
yeah.. i have been facing this since the last two hours or so..
thanks ghaskins..
ok
